Welcome to My Portfolio

Hi, I'm Catherine Guo, a senior at Northwestern studying Computer Science. This portfolio showcases my favorite projects, emphasizing my proficiency in various programming languages and my passion for visually appealing, interactive applications.

Artificial Life Project

This project investigates how body size and mutation affect the performance of robotic creatures designed to march to a beat. Conducting three experiments with varying restrictions on body structure while maintaining a constant population size, my study examines the impact of these factors on movement and fitness over generations.

View Project

Particle Swarms Project

Explore this project's dynamics through interactive simulations and GIFs showing my interactions with the system. A link to your own simulation experience on Glitch is available in the project's branch.

View Project

Parametric Generators Project

This project features code and descriptions along with GIFs that display interactions. You can experiment with the parametric generators via an external link in the project's branch.

View Project
